greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of non-isomorphic multiset partitions of weight n whose union is a k-set where each part has a different size.
comment: T(n,k) is the number of nonequivalent nonnegative integer matrices with total sum n and k nonzero rows with distinct column sums up to permutation of rows and columns.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325 (rows 0..50)
example: These correspond with the following matrices:
program: D(p,n)={my(v=vector(n)); for(i=1, #p, v[p[i]]++); my(u=EulerT(v)); prod(j=1, #u, 1 + u[j]*x^j + O(x*x^n))/if(!#p, 1, prod(i=1, p[#p], i^v[i]*v[i]!))}
M(n)={my(v=vector(n+1)); for(i=0, n, my(s=0); forpart(p=i, s+=D(p,n)); v[1+i]=Col(s)); Mat(vector(#v, i, v[i]-if(i>1, v[i-1])))}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 08 2020
